channel.title: Where do I download JDK 6.0
channel.description:
[url=http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp]http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp[/url]
No where here shows just JDK 6.0. When I try to compile the server for fr33sc4p3 source it says I need JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0. I downloaded 6u1 JDK, yet when I try to compile it, it still says you need JDK 5.0 or JDK 6.0. I would please like to have some one help me. Sorry if you think i'm a noob.

@MisterZ wrote:

File not found? lol I have never seen that before… Maybe your missing server file or something.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Where do I download JDK 6.0
item.dc:creator: @MisterZ MisterZ
item.description:
@MisterZ wrote:

This is the path:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java

He said he wanted JDK 6 but he should have JDK 6 update 1 because he looked on the java homepage and couldn’t find 6 but he must have update 1 because he tried using his compiler and it said he didn’t have jdk 5 or 6. If he has JDK 6 update 1 than the code I sent for his compiler would’ve worked… No need for all that complicated stuff when he only needs to edit his compiler.

Read full topic

item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

use perfect complier 1.9 and you dont have to do anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Where do I download JDK 6.0
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Let me explain why it won’t work if he hasn’t set his variables.

This

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe

tells it where to go to find JDK 6u1, but it has to go through the variables to do that. So if the variables still say jdk1.6.0, then it won’t find jdk1.6.0_01…

Read full topic

item.title: Where do I download JDK 6.0
item.dc:creator: @MisterZ MisterZ
item.description:
@MisterZ wrote:

it will work… If he has jdk 6 update 1.

Read full topic

item.title: Where do I download JDK 6.0
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Or he could use mine… They do the same thing… And just pasting that in won’t work unless he has his variables set, which is what my tutorial did…

Read full topic

item.title: Where do I download JDK 6.0
item.dc:creator: @MisterZ MisterZ
item.description:
@MisterZ wrote:

Edit your compiler and paste this:

@echo off COLOR 02 title Death Realm echo \\\\\\\\\\\-////////// echo Files Being Compiled... echo ///////////+\\\\\\\\\\ "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause cls COLOR 02 echo +++++++++++++++++++++ echo Files Compiled echo --------------------- pause

Read full topic

item.title: Where do I download JDK 6.0
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Here’s a tutorial I made to get it working with JDK 6u1.

Step 1:
[i]Ok, first we have to set the variables. Click on your Start Menu, then Control Panel, then System, then Advances, And finally Environmental Variables.

So, in short:
Start Menu – Control Panel – System – Advanced – Environmental Variables.[/i]

Step 2:
[i]Ok, now look for the variable named “path” in the list that is shown. Rename it “PATH” and then replace its variable value with this:[i]

c:\Windows\System32\;”C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\

Step 3:
Now make a new variable and name it “classpath.” Add this for its value:

C:\Program Files\Java\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\

Ok, now that you have your variables set, we need to edit the runserver.bat and compile.bat.

Step 4:
[i]Ok, right-click on your compile.bat and click edit. Now replace everything in it with this:[i]

@echo off title Compiler "%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Step 5:
[i]Ok, now right-click on you runserver.bat and click edit. Now replace everything in it with this:[i]

@echo off title Runserver set java="C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\java.exe" java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause

You are finished

This looks like Mod Taharok’s Tutorial, but it is edited to work with JDK 6u1.

Read full topic
